Line 29: Line 29:
==General Strike==
==General Strike==
In response to the police brutality and other perceived failings of [[Robert Birgeneau|Birgeneau]] and the [[UC Regents]], the General Assembly has called for a general strike at UC Berkeley on November 15th, 2011. The timing of the strike and protests will coincide with a meeting of the [[UC Regents]] the next day, in which they are expected to vote for further tuition increases. Many students and faculty are planning to not attend classes and walk out, or incorporate teach-ins, or spend at least part of the day actively protesting. Other student groups from around the state have announced plans to show solidarity. The [[UC Davis]] Faculty Association also voted to endorse the systemwide strike on November 15. <ref>[http://ucdfa.org/2011/11/11/dfa-endorses-occupy-cals-call-for-strike/ Davis Faculty Association Endorses Occupy Calâs Call for Strike]</ref>
In response to the police brutality and other perceived failings of [[Robert Birgeneau|Birgeneau]] and the [[UC Regents]], the General Assembly has called for a general strike at UC Berkeley on November 15th, 2011. The timing of the strike and protests will coincide with a meeting of the [[UC Regents]] the next day, in which they are expected to vote for further tuition increases. Many students and faculty are planning to not attend classes and walk out, or incorporate teach-ins, or spend at least part of the day actively protesting. Other student groups from around the state have announced plans to show solidarity. The [[UC Davis]] Faculty Association also voted to endorse the systemwide strike on November 15. <ref>[http://ucdfa.org/2011/11/11/dfa-endorses-occupy-cals-call-for-strike/ Davis Faculty Association Endorses Occupy Calâs Call for Strike]</ref>
